Relevent Links

The Ministry of Education last updated the TPA manual in 2010.

Current TPA Manual

There isn't a separate document outlining the Annual Learning Plan. There are several examples online but the only Ministry references are in Appendix D of the TPA manual. Also it only includes a secondary example. Theoretically every teacher must complete one every year, however, that is not always the case. ALPs must be completed in a TPA year.

App D ALP (sec. example)

The Learing Exchange has two page information sheet for principals. It would be nice if all principals followed these guidelines.

ALP/TPA Info for Principals

ETFO has the most information. You can search their site for both TPAs and ALPs.

ETFO - ALP ETFO - TPA

A search of the OSSTF site does not result in any additional information. If you search for NTIP or TPA you will be asked to save a PDF. It's a checklist. You could also check individual district sites, sometimes they provide more information.

OSSTF

OECTA has links for both the NTIP and the TPA process.

OECTA
